intro: Catesbaea longiflora, commonly known as the red mombin or yellow mombin, is a tropical plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America, where it thrives in warm, humid climates. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers that give way to orange or red fruits. Its fruits are edible and often used in traditional medicine and culinary practices. Catesbaea longiflora plays an important ecological role in supporting local wildlife and maintaining biodiversity in its native habitats.
